author: @cope
title: San Carlos Luanga y compañeros mártires, testigos de Fe en Uganda - Santoral - COPE
text:
La tarea misionera en los lugares más insospechados ha logrado con la ayuda del Espíritu. Hoy celebramos a San Carlos Luanga y compañeros mártires de Uganda. Son fruto de una ardua misión de religiosos en esas tierras. Esta Comunidad Eclesial vio cómo ponían sus primeras piedras evangelizadoras los Padres Blancos, cuyo carisma era precisamente la ayuda espiritual y humana en el Continente Africano. Su labor dio frutos. Poco a poco fueron floreciendo multitud de cristianos capaces de defender el Reino de los Cielos con su vida si era preciso. Cuando el emperador demostró una vida con bastante desorden moral, muchos seguidores del Evangelio sufrieron el martirio por recriminar al rey su pecado. En una de las veces en que murió el mensajero de palacio, pusieron casualmente a San Carlos Luanga. Éste siguió en la tónica de sus antecesores denunciando la conducta del monarca. Como muchos eran los conversos a la Fe, el hechicero real, disgustado por ello, le arrancó al rey, ya molesto de por sí con los cristianos, la orden de exterminio. Así surgió el decreto de exterminio de la religión católica, lo que animó a Carlos Luanga y otros 22 amigos a dar la cara por el Señor para que Él no se avergonzase de ellos en el Reino de su Padre. Después de ser arrojados a la mazmorra fueron sacados cruelmente a varios kilómetros de allí donde fueron quemados en medio de las oraciones que elevaban al Dios del Cielo. Tenían la completa seguridad de que el Padre les ayudaría en esos momentos tan cruciales y les acogería en la Patria Celestial. Un año después cambiaron las cosas, en el aspecto político y religioso. El rey fue derrotado y Carlos declarado Patrón de Uganda."}
24H RELIGIÓN
España Mundo JMJ Vaticano Firmas Liturgia Cultura Revista Ecclesia Programas 10 min con Jesús Vivir la Fe
Santoral
SANTO 3 JUNIO
San Carlos Luanga y compañeros mártires, testigos de Fe en Uganda Hoy es San Carlos Luanga y compañeros mártires. Por Redacción Religión
Jesús Luis Sacristán García Tiempo de lectura: 1’
1 jun. 2024 11:10Actualizado 14:31
La tarea misionera en los lugares más insospechados ha logrado con la ayuda del Espíritu. Hoy celebramos a San Carlos Luanga y compañeros mártires de Uganda. Son fruto de una ardua misión de religiosos en esas tierras. Esta Comunidad Eclesial vio cómo ponían sus primeras piedras evangelizadoras los Padres Blancos, cuyo carisma era precisamente la ayuda espiritual y humana en el Continente Africano.
Su labor dio frutos. Poco a poco fueron floreciendo multitud de cristianos capaces de defender el Reino de los Cielos con su vida si era preciso. Cuando el emperador demostró una vida con bastante desorden moral, muchos seguidores del Evangelio sufrieron el martirio por recriminar al rey su pecado. En una de las veces en que murió el mensajero de palacio, pusieron casualmente a San Carlos Luanga.
Éste siguió en la tónica de sus antecesores denunciando la conducta del monarca. Como muchos eran los conversos a la Fe, el hechicero real, disgustado por ello, le arrancó al rey, ya molesto de por sí con los cristianos, la orden de exterminio. Así surgió el decreto de exterminio de la religión católica, lo que animó a Carlos Luanga y otros 22 amigos a dar la cara por el Señor para que Él no se avergonzase de ellos en el Reino de su Padre.
Después de ser arrojados a la mazmorra fueron sacados cruelmente a varios kilómetros de allí donde fueron quemados en medio de las oraciones que elevaban al Dios del Cielo. Tenían la completa seguridad de que el Padre les ayudaría en esos momentos tan cruciales y les acogería en la Patria Celestial. Un año después cambiaron las cosas, en el aspecto político y religioso. El rey fue derrotado y Carlos declarado Patrón de Uganda.

author: 央媒看山东
title: 《新华每日电讯》聚焦青岛：人工智能赋能千行百业
text:
齐鲁网·闪电新闻4月3日讯 今日出版的《新华每日电讯》05版以《青岛：人工智能赋能千行百业》为题关注青岛。文章指出，青岛制造业优势明显，拥有较强的工业基础和多元化的工业门类。海尔、海信、青岛啤酒等企业在当地的深耕，也为人工智能提供了丰富的应用场景。目前青岛共有人工智能企业500余家，在智能家居、智能交通、智能医疗、智能机器人、智能制造和智能硬件等应用领域具备先发优势。全文如下。
青岛：人工智能赋能千行百业
新华社青岛4月1日电（记者张武岳）在位于山东青岛崂山区人工智能产业园的自然语义（青岛）科技有限公司，工作人员向记者展示了最新研发的语言类大模型“欧拉”：在一台笔记本电脑上，未接入互联网的状态下，该大模型就可以进行与DeepSeek、ChatGPT等相似的“思考”过程，回答记者提出的各种问题。
“‘欧拉’支持单台笔记本设备上离线使用，通过物理方式更新系统及语料库，可保障用户的数据隐私。同时支持本地推理和微调，依据用户需求形成私有大模型，满足个性化需求。”自然语义（青岛）科技有限公司首席架构师孙雁群说。
人工智能的发展速度超过大众想象，近两年成果不断涌现，相关产业进入快车道。作为国家人工智能创新应用先导区，青岛发挥城市算力优势，聚焦产业应用场景，走出一条属于自己的人工智能产业之路。
记者走访了解到，青岛制造业优势明显，拥有较强的工业基础和多元化的工业门类。海尔、海信、青岛啤酒等企业在当地的深耕，也为人工智能提供了丰富的应用场景。目前青岛共有人工智能企业500余家，在智能家居、智能交通、智能医疗、智能机器人、智能制造和智能硬件等应用领域具备先发优势。
乐聚智家（青岛）机器人技术有限公司的展厅中，一台名为“夸父”的人形机器人引起记者注意。身高1.6米左右的它不仅仅是个“话痨”，介绍公司情况及各类产品的同时，还能够完成多种复杂动作。
“在家庭服务场景中，机器人不知疲倦、‘情绪’稳定、功能丰富。”乐聚智家（青岛）机器人技术有限公司首席运营官梁佳介绍，依托成熟的家电家居产业基础和丰富的应用场景，乐聚智家与当地各方展开深入合作，目前已完成向山东大学、海尔等高校和企业的交付。不久的将来，搭载各种技能的家庭服务机器人即将走入千家万户。
推动人工智能赋能千行百业过程中，根据《青岛市人工智能产业创新发展行动计划（2024—2026年）》部署，聚焦工业制造、智慧海洋、现代农业、交通运输、医养健康、智慧教育、文化旅游、社会治理8个领域，青岛梳理首批102项应用场景清单，加大场景开放力度，开展多样化赋能应用。
随着生活节奏加快和环境变化，如今乳腺癌的发病率呈逐年上升趋势，成为威胁女性健康的重大疾病之一。而全国各地“两癌筛查”工作推进过程中，面临基层超声检测医生较少，检测水平参差不齐的困难，偶尔会出现漏查情况。
“我们的产品可以在一定程度上解决这一痛点。”小济（山东）智能科技发展有限公司总经理孙延辉对记者说，“小济医生”超声乳腺癌筛查机器人依托人工智能大模型以及近年来积累的大规模超声检测数据，可辅助基层医务人员进行大规模乳腺癌筛查，自动定位并标注病灶、自动计算病灶面积等，降低早期乳腺癌的漏诊、误诊率。有人工智能的帮助，进行筛查的医务人员无需是精通超声技术的医生，基层负担大大减轻。
据孙延辉介绍，自2022年起，机器人已在山东、广东、江苏、安徽等地完成超过50万人次乳腺癌筛查。“我们正在积极推进在甘肃陇南礼县的乳腺癌筛查项目，助力东西部医疗协作，提高全国各地乳腺癌筛查服务的公平性和可及性。”
“我们还将重点发力海洋领域大模型、垂直领域大模型、人形机器人等细分赛道，赋能低空经济、智能网联汽车、无人装备等强关联产业，答好人工智能‘必答题’。”青岛高科技工业园管理委员会人工智能产业促进部部长张华东说。
来源：新华每日电讯 编辑：费燕妮 责编：王全 审校：黄鹏伟 主编：刘畅

author: The Pioneer
title: With airport shut, IPL teams face challenge in Dharamsala
text:
The travel plans of IPL teams which are scheduled to play in Dharamsala this week have gone for a toss due to the temporary closure of the hill town’s airport after India’s missile attack on Pakistan and the Board of Control for Cricket in India (BCCI) is weighing its options to deal with the volatile situation.
Dharamsala, which is due to host the Punjab Kings vs Delhi Capitals clash on Thursday, has one more match left on schedule — the May 11 game between Punjab and Mumbai Indians.
For Thursday’s game, both teams have touched base.
But the usage of floodlights in the evening match is a security issue given the tense situation and could have a bearing on whether the match goes ahead as scheduled.
“We have not got any written intimation from either the BCCI, or the central and state governments about cancellation of tomorrow’s match. Unless there is any official instruction, we are going ahead with the schedule,” a Himachal Pradesh Cricket Association source told PTI.
The Sunday clash is a logistical challenge as well right now given that Mumbai Indians is in no position to travel due to the airport’s indefinite closure. The BCCI, it is learnt, is mulling the option of shifting the game to Mumbai.
The picturesque city is the second home base of Punjab Kings.
“We have not been told about the venue change yet. We are waiting to hear from the BCCI,” a Punjab Kings official said.
Delhi has very little time to figure out its logistics as the players have to be back in the national Capital for their next game, against Gujarat Titans, which is also on Sunday.
“Everything is fluid at the moment. Discussions are on with franchises and they are also internally discussing about what are the options of travelling from Dharamsala to Delhi in case the airport remains shut,” a BCCI source told PTI.
“One option (for Delhi Capitals) remains bus journey but then it is not just about teams but also the broadcast crew and equipment. It’s an evolving situation,” he added.
India carried out precision strikes on nine locations in Pakistan and Pakistan Occupied Jammu and Kashmir in retaliation to the Pahalgam terror attack in which 26 people, mostly tourists, were murdered.
At least 18 airports in the northern and western parts of the country have been temporarily shut owing to the military escalation. These include Srinagar, Leh, Jammu, Amritsar, Pathankot, Chandigarh, Jodhpur, Jaisalmer, Shimla, Dharamshala and Jamnagar.
Chandigarh, which is the nearest alternate airport for Dharamsala, is among those shut down for operations right now.

author: FOX 32 News
title: Protesters blast Chicago mayor for last-minute restrictions on DNC protests | FOX 32 Chicago
text:
CHICAGO - Activists who are planning a large protest at the Democratic National Convention are now upset with Mayor Brandon Johnson for making last-minute changes.
The group is currently staging a protest at the Dirksen Federal Plaza after the city approved their permit and then placed unexpected restrictions.
They've gathered at the Dirksen location to not only protest the city's changes, but an attorney representing the group filed an emergency injunction Wednesday night to stop the city from imposing those restrictions.
The city notified the coalition to march on the DNC that they are permitted to assemble and march next week, but only under certain conditions. That includes no stages or platforms, portable restrooms or toilets, tents or canopies and no sound equipment.
"They forced us to fill out new permit applications, and then we were shocked to get the letters from them yesterday, in which they granted our permits, subject to these conditions, and I quote: 'No stages or platforms, portable restrooms or toilets, tents or canopies, or sound equipment may be installed by your organization.' So essentially, we can meet at Union Park with potentially tens of thousands of people, not do a program that we've been planning for months, and then march on the short 1.1 mile route with sharp turns that they've offered," one speaker said.
The city has said some of the restrictions are needed due to multiple groups planning to rally or protest.

author: Henry Rivers
title: Metalpha's Profitability Breakthrough and Strategic Position in the Evolving Digital Asset Wealth Management Sector
text:
Metalpha's Profitability Breakthrough and Strategic Position in the Evolving Digital Asset Wealth Management Sector
In the rapidly evolving landscape of digital asset wealth management, Metalpha Technology Holding Limited (Nasdaq: MATH) has emerged as a standout player, driven by a dramatic financial turnaround and a strategic pivot toward operational scalability, regulatory alignment, and global market expansion. For the fiscal year ending March 31, 2025, the company reported $44.6 million in revenue, a net profit of $15.9 million, and a 266% year-over-year surge in income from its wealth management business. These figures mark a stark departure from its FY2023 performance, which included a $20.2 million net loss. The transformation is not merely a function of market tailwinds but a calculated response to structural shifts in institutional demand for digital assets and the growing clarity of global regulatory frameworks.
Operational Scalability: The Engine of Metalpha's Turnaround
Metalpha's profitability breakthrough is underpinned by its ability to scale operations with remarkable efficiency. For the first half of FY2025 (six months ended September 30, 2024), the company achieved $19.7 million in revenue, a 388% increase compared to the prior year, while net income surged to $6.0 million from a $3.9 million loss. This performance reflects a net margin of 30.7%, a rare feat for a company in its growth phase. How did Metalpha achieve this?
The answer lies in its strategic investments in automation and technology infrastructure. The company has deployed state-of-the-art systems to automate back-end processes such as portfolio management, risk assessment, and compliance reporting. These tools reduce manual labor, minimize errors, and enable real-time insights—critical for institutional clients managing complex digital portfolios. Additionally, Metalpha's focus on cloud-based infrastructure and AI-driven analytics aligns with broader industry trends, where automation is increasingly seen as a competitive moat.
The scalability is further evidenced by Metalpha's ability to grow revenue while shrinking overhead costs. For instance, gross profit rose from $5.6 million in FY2024 to $21.3 million in FY2025, demonstrating that the company is not only capturing more market share but also doing so with a leaner cost structure. This operational leverage is a key differentiator in a sector where many competitors struggle to balance innovation with profitability.
Regulatory Alignment: A Strategic Anchor in a Volatile Sector
The digital asset space is notoriously volatile, with regulatory uncertainty often acting as a drag on institutional adoption. Metalpha, however, has positioned itself as a regulatory bellwether. In FY2025, the company not only met Nasdaq's periodic filing requirements but also submitted its annual report to the SEC, a move that signals transparency and institutional-grade compliance. This alignment is critical for attracting institutional clients who demand robust governance frameworks and auditable systems.
Moreover, Metalpha's expansion into the Middle East through a joint venture with Abu Dhabi-based Gewan Holding and Standard Chartered Zodia Markets underscores its ability to navigate complex regulatory environments. The region is a growing hub for digital asset adoption, and Metalpha's entry via a trusted local partner mitigates geopolitical and compliance risks. This approach—leveraging local expertise to enter new markets—is a repeatable model that could drive further international growth.
Market Capture Potential: A Leader in a $2 Trillion Opportunity
The global digital asset wealth management market is projected to exceed $2 trillion in assets under management (AUM) by 2030, driven by institutional demand for crypto derivatives, tokenized real assets, and ESG-aligned portfolios. Metalpha is uniquely positioned to capture a significant share of this growth, thanks to its institutional-grade platform, blockchain expertise, and strategic partnerships.
For example, its collaboration with DogeOS to expand crypto innovation efforts highlights its commitment to staying at the forefront of technological advancements. Dogecoin, once a meme coin, has evolved into a serious contender in the digital asset space, and Metalpha's alignment with its ecosystem positions the company to benefit from broader adoption. Similarly, the company's $5 million share repurchase program—approved in 2025—reflects confidence in its long-term value and signals to investors that management is prioritizing capital efficiency.
Investment Implications: A Buy for the Long Game
Metalpha's FY2025 results and strategic initiatives paint a compelling case for investors seeking exposure to the digital asset wealth management sector. The company has transformed from a money-losing entity into a profit-generating machine with a scalable business model. Its 30.7% net margin and $5 million share repurchase program suggest that management is focused on both growth and shareholder returns.
However, risks remain. Regulatory shifts, particularly in the U.S. and EU, could disrupt the sector. Additionally, Metalpha's reliance on digital asset prices means it is exposed to market volatility. That said, the company's institutional-grade infrastructure and diversified partnership strategy mitigate these risks.
For investors with a 3–5 year horizon, Metalpha represents a high-conviction opportunity. The company's ability to scale profitably, align with regulatory trends, and capture emerging markets positions it as a leader in a sector poised for explosive growth. As the digital asset ecosystem matures, Metalpha's early mover advantage and operational discipline could translate into outsized returns.
In conclusion, Metalpha's FY2025 turnaround is not a fluke but the result of disciplined execution, strategic foresight, and a clear understanding of institutional demand. For those willing to navigate the sector's inherent volatility, the company offers a rare combination of scalability, profitability, and market leadership.

author: @le_parisien
title: JO Paris 2024, football : « Quelques petits moments de panique, vous êtes gentils… », s’agace Hervé Renard
text:
JO Paris 2024, football : « Quelques petits moments de panique, vous êtes gentils… », s’agace Hervé Renard
Un sélectionneur aux deux visages, comme l’équipe de France ce jeudi soir, s’est présenté face à la presse pour analyser, avec sévérité, la première prestation des Bleues dans ces Jeux de Paris 2024.
Hervé Renard a retrouvé le sourire aux alentours de 23h30, dans le couloir du stade de Lyon, théâtre ce jeudi soir d’une victoire spectaculaire mais à
l’arraché de son équipe de France féminine face à la Colombie (3-2). « Parce que je viens de croiser un ami qui a assisté à de bons moments, un grand ami du président de la Fédération zambienne, ça m’a fait plaisir de le croiser », détaille le sélectionneur des Bleues. Avant de se refermer et d’analyser avec sévérité, retrouvant le visage crispé de la deuxième période des Tricolores. Même s’il préfère ne pas trop réagir à chaud…
Que retient le sélectionneur de l’équipe de France entre la première période, superbe, et la deuxième, presque dramatique ?
HERVE RENARD. La victoire, c’est tout. C’est ce qu’il faut retenir. On va être positif.
Était-ce vos mots dans le vestiaire ?
Je n’ai rien dit. Je n’ai rien à dire.
On vous sent très énervé…
Parfois, le silence est plus fort que de crier, que des mots qui peuvent blesser. Ce soir, je vais m’abstenir de commentaires.
Comment expliquez-vous les quelques moments de panique en deuxième période ?
Quelques petits moments, vous êtes gentil… Quarante-cinq superbes premières minutes, trois buts, des enchaînements offensifs comme on n’a pas toujours été capable de le faire. On marque des jolis buts, avec un public qui s’enflamme et après… On a souvent l’habitude de dire que le football féminin n’est pas assez regardé mais il faut qu’on montre autre chose pour être plus regardé qu’en deuxième mi-temps. Sinon, les gens ne viendront pas au stade. Il faut regarder le miroir et se dire qu’on doit faire beaucoup mieux que ce qu’on a fait dans les 45 dernières minutes. Sans occulter et ne pas négliger une victoire face à la Colombie, quart de finaliste de la Coupe du monde.
Ce match est-il représentatif des qualités et des défauts de cette équipe de France ?
Oui, c’était un peu accentué. C’est ce sur quoi on doit faire des efforts. La seule explication qu’on puisse avoir, que je puisse avoir, c’est qu’il faut être plus fort mentalement. C’est tout.
N’est-ce pas physique, également ?
Non, non. Quand vous êtes capable de répondre au défi physique en première mi-temps… C’est parce que vous revenez (des vestiaires) avec un esprit tranquille, avec un 3-0 au compteur. Mais contre une équipe comme ça, ça ne va pas. Si elles peuvent vous marcher dessus, elles le font. Et c’est ce qu’elles ont fait. Et on est chanceux, même si c’est logique, de finir le match à onze contre dix (NDLR : exclusion de Ramirez à la 85e). Ce qui nous a valu des sueurs froides moins importantes.
Du côté positif, il y a ce doublé de Marie-Antoinette Katoto…
(Il coupe) Mais je l’ai dit : les 45 premières minutes, oui. Gagner un premier match, on aurait tous signé. On savait que ça serait difficile. Mais quand on est capable de faire cette première période, on doit faire un copier-coller. Le contraste est trop important pour être satisfait ce soir. On n’oublie pas non plus qu’on a trois points. L’objectif est de terminer premier de ce groupe.

author: Francisco Díaz
title: Aumento en ventas al menudeo impulsa la economía de Laredo en 2024
text:
Las [ventas al menudeo ](https://elmanana.com.mx/laredo-texas/2024/12/26/laredo-crime-stoppers-invita-la-ciudadania-formar-parte-del-menudo-bowl-139358.html)en las tiendas de Laredo han sido tan buenas en este año que ya tienen un aumento del 5.3 por ciento en comparación con el 2023 con diferencia de casi tres millones de dólares en impuestos sobre las ventas.
El reporte de la [oficina de la Contraloría de Texas](https://elmanana.com.mx/laredo-texas/2024/12/23/parejas-ya-no-tendran-que-esperar-72-horas-para-casarse-en-laredo-139252.html) indicó que en el último bimestre Laredo recibió 5 millones 464 mil 097 dólares por concepto de impuestos sobre las ventas registradas en los comercios locales.
En el mismo periodo, pero del año pasado, la ciudad recibió de la Contraloría de Texas 4 millones 813 mil 608 dólares por lo que hay un incremento del 13.5 por ciento favorable al 2024.
En lo que va del año, el municipio ya recibió participaciones de 64 millones 732 mil 122 dólares mientras hace un año fueron 61 millones 460 mil 117 dólares para una diferencia de casi 3.3 millones de dólares y un aumento del 5.3 por ciento.
Los comercios locales le cargan un 8 por ciento de impuestos a los compradores y de esta cifra casi dos centavos se regresan a Laredo mientras el resto se queda en Austin.
El reporte de la oficina de la Contraloría de Texas indicó que en este mes se distribuyeron 1.2 billones de dólares en impuestos sobre ventas entre municipios, condados, sistemas de tránsito y otras entidades.
Las ciudades recibieron 720.3 millones de dólares, un aumento del 5.7 por ciento sobre el mismo mes, pero del 2023 y un incremento del 1.9 por ciento en el año.
Los condados recibieron 71.6 millones de dólares, un 8.1 por ciento más que en diciembre del año pasado y un 2 por ciento en comparación con todo el año anterior.
Los sistemas de tránsito recibieron 245.5 millones de dólares, un 6.8 por ciento más que el mismo mes, pero del 2023 mientras de año a año hay un aumento del 1.9 por ciento.
Con estas cifras el estado de Texas y ciudades como Laredo ya regresaron a los niveles económicos que tenían antes de la pandemia de COVID 19.
topics: Economy, Business and Finance->business reporting and performance

author: @dailybruin
title: UCLA men's tennis readies for Friday season opener against UC Irvine
text:
Coach Billy Martin’s Bruins have their sights set on the mountaintop.
“We’re going to chase this national championship,” said junior Aadarsh Tripathi.
The first step towards the precipice begins Friday afternoon when No. 20 UCLA men’s tennis opens its season against UC Irvine at Anteater Tennis Stadium in Irvine. Originally scheduled at the Los Angeles Tennis Center, the match was relocated south due to ongoing fires in the surrounding area.
Coming off a second-round NCAA tournament appearance in 2024, the Bruins said they don’t see their high ambitions as a bold proclamation. It’s merely the culmination of months of endless work.
“I’ve never had more players spend the holidays here in LA instead of going back home,” Martin said. “Everybody was really, really in touch with not letting the month long break cause them to take a step backward from how much they were improving over the fall.”
Players like senior Alexander Hoogmartens continued to train in Westwood over winter break instead of returning to his home of Beersel, Belgium.
As Martin enters his 32nd year at the helm, he appears to exude a palpable optimism about this team.
“We’ve started with a really fresh slate this year,” Martin said. “Everybody on this team this year is really committed. We’ve got some great young talent, some good senior leadership. I’m very excited about this year. … I have high expectations for this team.”
These expectations are fueled in large part by the team’s camaraderie, which has only grown stronger in the wake of the LA county fires.
In the midst of these difficult times, the Bruins, who have been one of the few teams still practicing on campus during a week of remote learning at UCLA, have leaned on each other.
“My coach said, ‘I’m going to have my ringer on, so if you need … to evacuate, I will be right there,’” Tripathi said. “We all trust each other and know that we have each other’s back.”
On the court, UCLA’s success could start with ITA regional-winning, All-American Spencer Johnson – the sophomore aspiring to compete in the professional ranks after his UCLA tenure.
Fresh off a singles quarterfinal berth at the NCAA individual championships in November, Johnson has shown continued improvement in every facet of his game, his coach said.
“His forehand is getting more reliable,” Martin said. “(He) has gotten better at backhand, … improved in the backcourt. … He’s working hard on his mobility.”
The 2023-2024 Big West Freshman of the Year headlines the Bruins’ foes across the court. Spearheaded by Andy Nguyen, the Anteaters finished last season with their first trip back to the NCAA tournament since 2022.
This Anteaters’ team is led by the reigning Big West Coach of the Year Mike Saunders and also boasts three other All-Big West players, including Noah Zamora, Hiroki Sakagawa and Rithvik Krishna.
“They’ve got solid players at every spot in their lineup,” Martin said. “We’ve seen these players individually all fall and battled a lot of them multiple times. (There’s) mutual respect for each other.”
But for the Bruins, this season centers on an even-keeled and joyous mentality.
“Just keep focusing (on) that same mindset. … Calm and composed and keeping (our) level the same,” Tripathi said. “It’s definitely a surreal experience playing as a team, because in tennis, you really never play as a team other than college. This is great. I’m ready to go fight alongside my brothers.”
